section.title: trace
section.para: trace command interacts with javax.slee.management:name=Trace MBean. It is standard JSLEE MBean. trace allows to manage trace level and tracers instances. Based on options passed to operations it performs operations on 1.1 and 1.0 logging facilities. It supports following operations:

section.title: tracers-used
section.para: tracers-used operation returns names of tracers requested by notification source. Requires notification source as argument.

section.title: tracers-set
section.para: tracers-set operation fetches list of tracers for which level has been set explicitly via one of setLevel methods. Requires notification source as argument.

section.title: set-level
section.para: set-level operation sets level of tracer. Does not support argument. Supports following options:

listitem.para:
specifies ComponentID for 1.0 trace facility. Requires valid ComponentID as argument. It excludes --nsrc option. Example call:
Set trace level in 1.0 facility ./twiddle.sh trace -s --cid=SbbID[name=ProxySbb,vendor=mobicents,version=1.1] --level=WARNING

specifies notification source of which tracer(!) level should be set. Excludes --cid option. Requires valid notification source as argument.
Set tracer level ./twiddle.sh trace -s --nsrc=ProfileTableNotification[table=xxx] --name=tracer.name --level=WARNING
specifies tracer name. Requires name as argument.

specifies level for 1.0 trace facility and 1.1 tracer. Requires valid level representation as argument. It accepts following values:
SEVERE
WARNING
INFO
CONFIG
FINE
FINER
FINEST

section.title: un-set-level
section.para: un-set-level operation unsets level of SLEE 1.1 tracer. Invoking this operation informs Trace facility to derive level for tracer from its parent. Does not support argument. Following options are supported:

listitem.para: specifies notification source of which tracer(!) level should be unset. Requries valid notification source as argument.
specifies tracer name. Requires name as argument.

section.title: get-level
section.para: get-level operation retrieves level of trace facility or tracer. Does not support arument. Following options are supported:

listitem.para:
specifies ComponentID for 1.0 trace facility. Requires valid ComponentID as argument. It excludes --nsrc option. Example call:
Get trace level in 1.0 facility ./twiddle.sh trace -g --cid=SbbID[name=ProxySbb,vendor=mobicents,version=1.1]

specifies notification source of which tracer(!) level should be fetched. Excludes --cid option. Requries valid notification source as argument.
Set tracer level ./twiddle.sh trace -g --nsrc=ProfileTableNotification[table=xxx] --name=tracer.name
specifies tracer name. Requires name as argument.
